SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: In the event of early failure of standard extracranial-intracranial arterial bypass, elective but prompt revision surgery is generally attempted under the assumption that early occlusion is permanent
However, little is known about the occurrence of spontaneous revascularization

OBJECTIVE: To estimate the frequency and time course of spontaneous recanalization in primary extracranial-intracranial arterial bypass occlusion and re-evaluate diagnostic and therapeutic options facing spontaneous development
METHODS AND RESULTS: In a retrospective analysis 176 patients with standard superficial temporal artery/middle cerebral artery bypass were included
Twenty-three patients had primary bypass occlusion
In 7 cases spontaneous recanalization was observed
Follow-up of these cases is presented
CONCLUSIONS: Early bypass occlusion has a high incidence of spontaneous recanalization within the first year
In stable patients the first choice may be noninvasive follow-up and postponing revision operation
